books.title: GHETTOSIDE
books.author: Jill Leovy

books.description: The executive director of the Equal Justice Initiative in Alabama describes his work in defense of poor people and the unjustly accused.
books.title: JUST MERCY
books.author: Bryan Stevenson

books.description: The narrative, first published in 1853, of a freeman who was sold into slavery and spent 12 years in bondage before escaping. The basis of the movie.
books.title: TWELVE YEARS A SLAVE
books.author: Solomon Northup

books.description: A tale of two Wes Moores: the author, a Rhodes scholar; the other, a man in prison.
books.title: THE OTHER WES MOORE
books.author: Wes Moore

books.description: Humorous essays on what it is like to be awkward in a world that glorifies cool.
books.title: MISADVENTURES OF AWKWARD BLACK GIRL
books.author: Issa Rae

books.description: The story of a brilliant young man from a New Jersey ghetto who graduated from Yale but was murdered as a drug dealer at age 30.
books.title: THE SHORT AND TRAGIC LIFE OF ROBERT PEACE
books.author: Jeff Hobbs

books.description: A history of the Underground Railroad, the network that spirited slaves to freedom in the decades before the Civil War.
books.title: GATEWAY TO FREEDOM
books.author: Eric Foner

books.description: A man's quest for a meaningful life through critical moments and places in recent history, from Afghanistan to the White House and Wall Street.
books.title: THE WORK
books.author: Wes Moore

books.description: Courage, change and basketball's lost triumph.
books.title: THE SECRET GAME
books.author: Scott Ellsworth

books.description: A Harvard historian’s survey of the industrialization of cotton and its effects on the world’s economy and social relations.
books.title: EMPIRE OF COTTON
books.author: Sven Beckert

books.description: A biography of Perry Wallace, the first African American basketball player in the SEC and a look at the collision of race and sports in the South.
books.title: STRONG INSIDE
books.author: Andrew Maraniss
